definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: I let the plane down gently, pulled off the runway, and taxied back to parking.
sentences.chinese: 我穩穩地降落了飛機，駛離跑道，滑行回了停機場。

sentences.english: Webcast of the take-off and landing will go live 5 minutes prior to each event.
sentences.chinese: 網上直播的起飛和降落會活5分鐘前，每個事件。

sentences.english: If there is a thunderstorm at the target airport, the flight can land to alternate airport .
sentences.chinese: 如果該機場爲雷雨天氣，飛機可以到備降機場降落。

sentences.english: The aeroplane landed us at the airport in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 飛機把我們降落在巴塞羅那機場。

sentences.english: It didn't take long for Zimmer to realize he had landed on a school of crappie.
sentences.chinese: 它沒有多久齊默實現他對學校的克拉皮降落。

sentences.english: Let your love in kisses rain. on my lips and eyelids pale.
sentences.chinese: 讓伱的愛隨吻的密雨降落，落在莪蒼白的脣和眼丄。

sentences.english: It came back down to Earth on a parachute and – fittingly – landed in a Christmas tree plantation near Basingstoke.
sentences.chinese: 巧合的是，它降落在貝辛斯托克附近的一棵聖誕樹上。

sentences.english: Ashfalls can suffocate plants and poison livestock.
sentences.chinese: 降落的火山灰能悶死植物，毒害牲畜。

sentences.english: Right now you're holding a parachute from a German flare in your hands.
sentences.chinese: 現在你手裏拿的是一個德國照明彈上的降落傘。

sentences.english: We watched the drop of the parachutists from the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我們看着傘兵從飛機上降落下來。

sentences.english: Here he let the Enchanted Horse come to the ground, but he did not at once enter the city.
sentences.chinese: 才把馬降落在地上，但並沒有立刻進城去。

sentences.english: A second stone man followed, landing back beside the tiller.
sentences.chinese: 接着是第二個石人，他降落在船舵旁。

sentences.english: Jump out of a plane while still sewing your parachute and you'll get a good sense of pace in this business.
sentences.chinese: 或者說當你還在縫補降落傘的時候就跳出飛機。

sentences.english: When our plane landed in the storm, it hit the runway with a jolt.
sentences.chinese: 只是飛機降落時有些顛簸，空中有云，我想是這樣的。

sentences.english: The cherubic feather falls in my front.
sentences.chinese: 天使的羽毛降落在我的面前。

sentences.english: This amazing bionic bird can take-off, fly, and land autonomously.
sentences.chinese: 這種智能鳥可以自動起飛，飛行以及降落。

definition: to rise to the sky/to lift off/to levitate/liftoff
to force a plane to land
to return to the point of departure
(of aircraft) to take off and land
